Issues.Title: [release/8.0] Fix empty `OpenFileDialog.FileNames` when `AutoUpgradeEnabled=false` and `Multiselect = true`
Issues.Body:
Backport of https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10849

 Fix the parsing logic for `GetMultiselectFiles`. When using `OpenFileDialog`​ that has properties `AutoUpgradeEnabled = false`​  and  `Multiselect = true​` , selecting a single file or mutiple files will result in no file names being returned, causing this to be unusable.​ The logic has been updated to include the null delimiter from the directory path when selecting multiple files and to check if we have single file case before proceeding with rest of parse.
 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10867)

Issues.Title: Explore WinForms feature switch coverage in System.Windows.Forms project
Issues.Body:
This is a draft PR to solicit feedback and not meant to be merged.

Remove `nowarn` for [IL2026](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/deploying/trimming/trim-warnings/il2026) and explore the impact on trimming. The RUC warnings are currently at leaf level and making WinForms assemblies [trim compatible](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/deploying/trimming/fixing-warnings) require blubbling these warning up to public API level or suppressing the warnings. Bubbling up the warnings from the leaf level to public API root level will encompass a fairly large graph of API nodes, and likely make WinForms unusable with trimming. Suppressing warnings, especially at the leaf level can reduce the size of this graph but can be potentially very dangerous if not done correctly and require careful analysis to ensure that the trimmed WinForms surface area work correctly. The current plan is to use a feature switch to guard against trim problematic features in a trimmed WinForms application.

This PR explores the space of suppression so as to understand the WinForms feature switch coverage and get feedback from domain experts on problematic areas for trimming to further expand the feature switch coverage. Current identified areas where a [feature switch](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/10813) will restrict trimmed WinForms are:
- Use of [ComponentModel](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/issues/97841) area
- Use of ICustomTypeDescriptor
- [DefaultValueAttribute](https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/issues/97842)
- [Binding ](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/10741)to move to a strongly typed model
- Designer

The commits in this PR show the impacted APIs from the leaf level bubbling up the call graph. It doesn't show the full graph since the goal is to identify the suppression points closer to the leaf level APIs. These commits also show suppressions applied at leaf level (those no longer need to be bubbled up). Current suppressions are not done as we envision how we do this in the final product. For example, the suppression is applied at method level instead of the exact location callsite. This approach was adopted to expedite the feedback.

These commits show base classes and interfaces that could cause trimming concerns since derived classes call RUC methods. This can be seen via the [IL2046](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/deploying/trimming/trim-warnings/il2046) warning. This might mean that the feature guard could restrict usage on these types for a trimmed WinForms application. Some of these impacted types are;
 - ITypeResolutionService, ISerializable, IPropertyNotifySink, Control.BackColor
 - Binding helper classes (BindingSource, BindingManagerBase)
 - Com2ExtendedBrowsingHandler<T>
 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10866)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Explore WinForms feature switch coverage in System.Windows.Forms project" (#10866)

Issues.Title: Update System.Private.Windows.Core.csproj
Issues.Body:
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10525 introduced System.Private.Windows.Core.csproj which multi-targets. Unfortunately that project was declared incorrectly as the `<TargetFramework>` property needs to be unset as it's defined in the root of the repo.

This caused overbuilds of System.Private.Windows.Core.csproj which ultimately manifested in build race conditions.

The binlog shows that the `Csc` task is invoked twice for the same TFM and hence the race condition:

### Global properties for CSC 1 project evaluation
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/7412651/f13dfdfc-8cb7-4ca6-ba8a-7998271b6f17)

### Global properties for CSC 2 project evaluation
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/7412651/c5906e57-6195-48b7-a4aa-da8c8c4c62bc)

Notice that the only difference between those two is the `TargetFramework` global property. The first evaluation also builds for the same TFM as that property is defined in the root repo.
 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10864)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Update System.Private.Windows.Core.csproj" (#10864)

Issues.Title: Use Native DataObject Pointer in ComDataObjectAdapter
Issues.Body:
Fixes #10853 

When dealing with COM pointers that are not ComWrappers-created unmanaged wrappers and built-in COM interop is turned on, `Marshal.GetObjectForIUnknown` generates an RCW under the hood for us to use, which is why we are able to cast the COM data object  we receive back seamlessly to `System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes`. However when built-in COM interop is turned off and the COM pointer we receive is not a ComWrappers-created unmanaged wrapper, we need to be able to work off of the native pointer

Trimmed drag/drop
Before:
![dragb4](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/30007367/74b829c7-0008-4bb0-830f-7d5074a1a34b)

After:
![drag](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/30007367/34ec8dda-5918-443b-abe7-b14eb195a6c9)

 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10854)

Issues.Title: Drag/drop Not Working with External Items When Trimming On
Issues.Body:
Drag/drop external items does not work when trimming is turned on. We are expecting the managed object we get on [DropTarget.PrepareOutgoingDropData](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/f7d1be6c8af5445fe9ad041ad2f8f62ddc4a8ece/src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/OLE/DropTarget.cs#L56) to be either a `System.Windows.Forms.IDataObject` or `System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject`, but the object we get back is neither of these. This is because the object is not a ComWrappers created object and built in com interop is not supported, so we are not getting that automatic wrapping that built in com provides. We need to be wrapping the COM object ourselves.

Repro:
1. Navigate to winforms TrimTest project
2. Edit the .csproj to turn on trimming:
```.csproj
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">
 <PropertyGroup>
    <OutputType>WinExe</OutputType>
    <TargetFramework>net9.0-windows</TargetFramework>
    <UseWindowsForms>true</UseWindowsForms>
    <PublishTrimmed>true</PublishTrimmed>
    <ImplicitUsings>true</ImplicitUsings>
    <_SuppressWinFormsTrimError>true</_SuppressWinFormsTrimError>
  </PropertyGroup>
</Project>
```
3. Run 'dotnet publish' in command line where TrimTest lives
4. Run published TrimTest and drag a string from somewhere external onto the TextBox
5. Observe being unable to drop
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Drag/drop Not Working with External Items When Trimming On" (#10853)

Issues.Body:
### Environment

Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2022 (64-bit) - Current
Version 17.8.5

### .NET version

.NET 8

I've been developing in .NET Framework for 4 last years and this never happened.
I switched to .NET 8 only because this is a small sample project.

Place some items and move them using keyboard
Using only vanilla WinForms controls.

Issues.Title: Incorporate DataRepeater control into Winforms
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Visual Studio 17.8.5

### .NET version

Net Framework 4.8

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

2019

### Issue description

DataRepeater control is not visible on the form and any change to any control on the form corrupts the datarepeater and all controls within it disappear.

Please incorporate the DataRepeater code into github so I can try to fix the issue.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open form
2. DataRepeaters appear in the form but when you click on them they do not exist
3. Any change to the form will corrupt the DataRepeater and all controls within it will disappear 

### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Incorporate DataRepeater control into Winforms" (#10848)
